snippet: Using public Medicaid dollars to buy private insurance policies makes sense, politically and substantively.
abstract: Editorial examines benefits of using public Medicaid dollars to buy private insurance policies, which some Republican-led states have proposed due to their refusal to expand their Medicaid programs; raises the uncertainty of whether doing so will end up costing more money than traditional Medicaid.
lead_paragraph: Using public Medicaid dollars to buy private insurance policies makes sense, politically and substantively.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
